title: Where to Reflect
text: Because this is a horizontal reflection, we have to reflect the function over the y-axis.

title: Y-Axis
text: Reflections over the y-axis mean the x-values for each y-value are the opposite of what they would normally be. These are denoted as $$g(x)=f(-x)$$, where g(x) is the reflected function.

title: Y-Axis
text: What is the expression of s(t) after its reflection?

title: Y-Axis
text: In this case, f(-x) is the same as s-(t), or $$\sqrt{-t}$$.
